thread.title: Devils sign goaltender Ken Appleby to 3-year contract
thread.title_full: Devils sign goaltender Ken Appleby to 3-year contract

title: Devils sign goaltender Ken Appleby to 3-year contract
text:
Goaltender Ken Appleby gets 3-year entry-level contract from New Jersey Devils THE ASSOCIATED PRESS First Posted: October 05, 2015 - 3:07 pmLast Updated: October 05, 2015 - 3:07 pm We also have more stories about: (click the phrases to see a list) 
People: 

NEWARK, New Jersey â€” The New Jersey Devils have signed goaltender Ken Appleby to a three-year, entry-level contract. 
Devils executive vice president and general manager Ray Shero announced the deal Monday. 
The 20-year-old Appleby attended training camp as an amateur tryout, after previously attending the team's development camp in July. He had spent the past three seasons with Oshawa (OHL), where he helped lead the Generals to the 2015 Ontario Hockey League and Memorial Cup Championships. 
Last season, he led the league with a 2.08 goals-against average, .924 save percentage and six shutouts (tie). During the OHL playoffs, Appleby was 16-5 with two shutouts and a 2.24 GAA.
